text:
Here's how to connect your
Xbox controller to your iPhone.

In this video, we'll
cover four quick steps
to get your controller connected.
To get started, take your Xbox controller

and press down the Xbox
button to turn it on.
Then on the back,

hold down the bind
button for a few seconds.

Once the Xbox button starts
flashing, you can let go.
With the controller in pairing mode,
navigate to "Settings" on your iPhone.

Click the Bluetooth tab
and make sure it's enabled.
If not, press the slider to turn it on.

With Bluetooth on and the
controller in pairing mode,

"Xbox Wireless Controller"
should appear below
in the available devices.
Tap on it to connect.
Wait a moment,

and the controller should
confirm that it is connected
and appear under "MY DEVICES."

Your Xbox controller is now
all set to game on iPhone.

Go to the App Store or
check out Apple Arcade

to find some games that
support controllers.
